t: Amazon Brand Registry | Sell on Amazon

t: VFAUOSIT Brand Kitchen Faucets Recalled Due to Dangerous Lead Exposure for Young Children; Sold on Amazon.com by Whisper08 | CPSC.gov
s: Consumers should immediately stop using these faucets and contact Whisper08 about disposal and a refund. Consumers will need to provide a photograph of disposal and their order number to receive the refund. Whisper08 is contacting all known purchasers directly.Until these faucets can be replaced, ...

t: Pukemark, Sweatyrocks, Demonlick: Made-for-Amazon Brand Names Are Getting Ridiculously Surreal
s: October 14, 2020 - I was recently shopping for clothes on Amazon when I noticed bizarre brand names popping up—more bizarre than usual, I mean. It’s common to come across unfamiliar brands on Amazon, where sellers are constantly fashioning product lines and whole brands around what shoppers are searching for.

t: Requirements and tips for enrolling a brand in Amazon Brand Registry ...
s: June 4, 2024 - This program can help connect you with IP legal service providers that offer trademark-registration services at competitive rates. Brands who use IP Accelerator also get faster access to Brand Registry benefits, which they can enjoy while their trademark application is pending.

t: All Your Favorite Brands, From BSTOEM to ZGGCD - The New York Times
s: February 11, 2020 - Brands like Pvendor, RIVMOUNT, FRETREE and MAJCF. Gloves emblazoned with names like Nertpow, SHSTFD, Joyoldelf, VBIGER and Bizzliz. Gloves with hundreds or even thousands of apparently positive reviews, available for very low prices, shipped quickly, for free, with Amazon Prime.

t: Amazon’s new 'Buy for Me' feature helps customers find and buy products from other brands’ sites
s: April 3, 2025 - New beta feature allows customers to use their Amazon Shopping app to complete purchases from other brand retailer websites if Amazon doesn’t sell the item directly.

t: Amazon says it’s permanently banned 600 Chinese brands for review fraud | The Verge
s: September 17, 2021 - Following the high-profile disappearances of Aukey, Mpow, RavPower, Choetech and more, Amazon now says it’s cracked down on 3,000 seller accounts across 600 Chinese brands over the past five months.
